results.title: Slys = Slyss
results.brief_description: An unusual safety film without spoken commentary, tracing the complete story of one particular accident involving a young cyclist. We follow the ambulance over icy roads to the accident, the return journey to the hospital where examination, x-ray and operation take place. Only when the girl’s companion visits the hospital do we learn that carelessness was the cause.

results.title: Skippy and the 3 RRR's
results.brief_description: Shows how a first grade boy is taught reading, writing and arithmetic by a teacher who utilises the boy’s interests to help him to realise his own need for learning. He learns by experience that school is a fascinating place where he is made to feel part of the group and where he receives sympathetic understanding.

results.title: Simplification
results.creator_credit: Soren Melson and Nordisk Film Junior
results.brief_description: Simplification in manufacturing and the consequent benefits to producer and consumer. How standardisation of sizes, reduction of the number of sizes and types of an article produced have resulted in smoother work flow, greater specialisation and reduced handling costs. Examples from the wood industry, where simplification has enabled well-designed furniture to be produced at very reasonable cost, while standard sizes of barrel staves and fruit and fish cases enable mills to use scrap wood and slack time knowing that the product can be readily sold as required. Stresses the relation between planned production, consumer needs and advertising. English soundtrack.

results.title: Silkworm
results.creator_credit: Vikichi Ohta and National Farm Cinema Association of Japan
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the silkworm, and silkworm care on a Japanese farm. Soon after emerging from her chrysalis the female silk moth lays over 500 eggs, which hatch in a few days. The young silkworms are fed chopped mulberry leaves and after four weeks are fully grown and are moved to straw racks where they spin their cocoons. Close-ups and microcinematography show the growth processes in detail.

results.title: Silage making on every farm
results.brief_description: One of the problems of raising stock is to get enough protein food for it, particularly on an all-the-year-round basis. Silage is the answer, and this film for farmers goes into all the details of silos and silage making, showing the most straightforward and economical methods.
